text: Focaccia (Italian pronunciation: [foˈkattʃa]; Ligurian: fugassa [fyˈɡassa]) is a type of flatbread. It is cooked in the oven. Its style and texture is similar to the pizza dough. Focaccia may be used as a side to many meals. It can also be used as a base for sandwich bread. == Types == * (focaccia with rosemary) is a common focaccia style. It may be served as an antipasto, appetizer, table bread, or snack. * (focaccia with sage), which is prepared by simply changing rosemary with sage. * (focaccia with cheese), which is from Recco. == References == Category:Breads Category:Italian food Category:Liguria
title: Focaccia
